paper_abstract: A graph G of order n is called hyperenergetic if E(G) > 2n - 2, where E(G) is the energy of G. In this paper it is shown that Kneser graph K(n:r) is hyperenergetic for any naturals n and r >= 2 with n >= 2r + 1. Also we prove that for r >= 2, the complement of Kneser graph, E((K(n:r)) over bar), is hyperenergetic.
paper_title: Kneser Graphs and their Complements are Hyperenergetic
